alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:08PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northwestern Knox and southwestern Clay Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 207 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over London-Corbin Airport, or near London, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Maplesville around 215 PM EDT. Tuttle and Langnau around 220 PM EDT. Marydell, Lida, Cane Creek, Deer Lick, Blackwater, Portersburg, Gibbs, Crawford and Knoxfork around 225 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bush, Lake, Sasser, Byron, Tedders, Sprule, Fletcher, Pigeonroost, Hooker, Urban, Cottongin, Sidell, Woollum, Grace and Haven. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
